meanings.definition: The quality of having a large amount of mass.
meanings.sent1: The massiness of the boulder made it difficult to move.
meanings.sent2: The elephant's massiness caused the ground to shake.
meanings.sent3: The massiness of the cake made it impossible to lift with one hand.
meanings.sent4: The massiness of the silence in the room was almost palpable.
meanings.sent5: The massiness of the fog enveloped the entire valley.

meanings.definition: The state of being heavy or bulky.
meanings.sent1: Carrying the massiness of the suitcase up the stairs was exhausting.
meanings.sent2: The massiness of the old furniture made it hard to rearrange the room.
meanings.sent3: The massiness of the clouds made them look like giant cotton balls.
meanings.sent4: The massiness of the traffic jam seemed to slow down time itself.
meanings.sent5: The massiness of the package made it challenging to fit through the door.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being dense or weighty.
meanings.sent1: The massiness of the dough made it perfect for baking bread.
meanings.sent2: The massiness of the bookshelf made it sturdy and reliable.
meanings.sent3: The massiness of the blanket made it ideal for keeping warm in winter.
meanings.sent4: The massiness of the atmosphere added a sense of gravity to the room.
meanings.sent5: The massiness of the anchor kept the boat secure in the harbor.
